column5: Picked up a new Normark Finbore Micro-Drill.  It collapses to just 19.5 inches, which makes it a dream to pack.
Pretty snazzy Clampet, and should lighten your load alot while hiking across the ice !!
The offset handle is definitely the way to go.  Nice gear.

If you don't mind me asking where did you buy it? I've been thinking of buying one because my 6 year old son keeps bugging me to go ice fishing and an auger would make it esaier to get out without booking something.
id rather use a normal size fin bore so i dont have to get on my knees to drill a hole
i believe you can pricematch CTC with lebarons for $69.99 i think. and ctc will beat it by 10% the difference.
This auger telescopes to regular lenght. No need to get on my knees (at least not for fishing)
afterlooking more into it, im kind of regretting of getting the regular swede bore. shouldve bought this one instead!! anyone want to buy mine? =)
Nice little auger you got there.  Love the portability factor.  Is that OJ's glove?!?!  Corn Nug
cool, does it come in 8 inch?
aha ok thanx, i may consider, cus its tuff to carry around a normal one, or maybe i should just buy a sled...
nice auger clampet. i think normark owes me some comission for the sale, and product demo  !!
I don't think its going to work very well once the ice get 2 1/2 to 3 ft thick ..  but sure looks good for 1st ice ..

Can anyone report how well it works ?  I've got a strikemaster lazer and really like it, but it's a 7 inch and when the ice gets thick and you're on your 15th hole the 'ole arms really start to sting.   I,m thinking for panfish/perch 6" or less might be a bit easier on the system.
same here, i got a 8inch auger, might downsize to a 6 or 4, ice is getting thick! and tiring
and when i say downsize, i meant get another one as well..
